question: He caught the northbound Howard line. Got off at Sheridan. Stopped at 7-11. Purchased six- pack of beer and a box of Captain Crunch. Returned home.
answer: All right, you're relieved. Use the usual exit.

question: Do you know when we're going to make contact?
answer: Soon.

question: Just between you and me, you don't believe it, do you? You don't believe this guy is the one?
answer: I think Morpheus believes he is.

question: I know. But what about you?
answer: I think Morpheus knows things that I don't.

question: Yeah, but if he's wrong --
answer: Did you hear that?

question: Shit. Morpheus! The link was traced! I don't know how.
answer: I know. Stay calm.

question: Are there any agents?
answer: Yes.

question: Goddamnit!
answer: You have to focus. There is a phone. Wells and Laxe. You can make it.

question: All right --
answer: Go.

question: JACKON
answer: Fuckin' idiots don't know shit.

question: Do you want to know what the Matrix is, Neo? SUPERASTIC
answer: What the hell...

question: TIMAXE
answer: What do you want, Anthony? You got the money this time? I don't know. I have to work tomorrow. Yeah, yeah. Sure, I'll go.

question: What do you want, Anthony? You got the money this time? I don't know. I have to work tomorrow. Yeah, yeah. Sure, I'll go.
answer: Hello, Neo.

question: How did you know that --
answer: I know a lot about you. I've been wanting to meet you for some time.

question: Who are you?
answer: My name is Trinity.

question: Trinity? The Trinity? The Trinity that cracked the I.R.S. Kansas City D-Base?
answer: That was a long time ago.

question: Gee-zus.
answer: What?

question: I just thought... you were a guy.
answer: Most guys do.

question: Do you want to go sorewhere and talk?
answer: No. It's safe here and I don't have much time.

question: That was you on the board tonight. That was your note, wasn't it?
answer: I had to gamble that you would see and they wouldn't.

question: Who wouldn't?
answer: I can't explain everything to you. I'm sure that it's all going to seem very strange, but I brought you here to warn you, Neo. You are in a lot of danger.

question: What? Why?
answer: They're watching you. Something happened and they found out about you. Normally, if our target is exposed we let it go. But this time, we can't do that.

question: I don't understand --
answer: You came here because you wanted to know the answer to a hacker's question.

question: The Matrix. What is the Matrix?
answer: Twelve years ago I met a man, a great man, who said that no one could be told the answer to that question. That they had to see it, to believe it. He told me that no one should look for the answer unless they have to because once you see it, everything changes. Your life and the world you live in will never be the same. It's as if you wake up one morning and the sky is falling. The truth is out there, Neo. It's looking for you and it will find you, if you want it to. That's all I can tell you right now. Good-bye, Neo. And good luck.

question: Wait. Who was it? Who was the man?
answer: You know who.

question: Shitshitshit. Yes, Mr. Rhineheart. Perfectly clear. If I was late again, I'm going to be fired. Yeah. That's me. Hello?
answer: Hello, Neo. This is Morpheus. I had hoped for this conversation to take place under less adverse conditions, but you can never count on hope, can you, Neo?

question: ... no.
answer: I've been watching you, Neo, and I want to meet you. I don't know if you're ready to see what I want to show you, but unfortunately, we have run out of time. They're coming for you, Neo. And I'm not sure what they're going to do.

question: Who's coming for me?
answer: Stand up and see for yourself.

question: Right now?
answer: Yes. Now. Do it slowly. Slowly. The elevator.

question: Holy fuckin' shit!
answer: Yes.

question: What the fuck do they want with me?!
answer: I'm not sure. But, if you don't want to find out, you better get out of there.

question: How?!
answer: I can guide you out, but you have to do exactly what I say. The cubicle across from you is empty.

question: But what if...?
answer: Go! Now! Stay here for a moment. A little longer... When I tell you, go to the end of the row to the first office on the left, stay.as low as you can. Now. Good. Now there is a window. Open it.

question: How do you know all this?
answer: The answer is coming, Neo. Outside, there's a scaffold. You can use it to get to the roof.

question: No! It's too far away.
answer: There's a small ledge. It's a short climb. You can make it.

question: No way, no way, this is crazy.
answer: Don't be controlled by your fear, Neo. There are only two ways out of this building. One is that scaffold. The other is in their custody. You take a chance either way. I leave it to you.

question: As you can see, we've had our eye on you for some time now, Mr. Anderson. It seems that you have been living two lives. In one life, you are Thomas A. Anderson, program writer for a respectable software company. You have a social security number, you pay your taxes and you help your land lady carry out her garbage. The other life is lived in computers where you go by the hacker alias Neo, and are guilty of virtually every computer crime we have a law for, including the unauthorized use of the D.M.V. system for the removal of automobile boots. One of these,lives has a future. One of them does not. I'm going to be as forthcoming as I can be, Mr. Anderson. You are here because we need your help. We know that you have been contacted by a certain individual. A man who calls himself Morpheus. Whatever you think you know about this man is irrelevant to the fact that he is wanted for acts of terrorism in more countries than any other man in the world. He is considered by many authorities to be the most dangerous man alive. My colleagues believe that I am wasting my time with you, but I believe you want to do the right thing. It is obvious that you are an intelligent man, Mr. Anderson, and that you are interested in the future. That is why I believe you are ready to put your past mistakes behind you and get on with your life. We are willing to wipe the slate clean, to give you a fresh start and all we are asking in return is your cooperation in bringing a known terrorist to justice.
answer: Yeah. Wow. That sounds like a real good deal. But I think I have a better one. How about I give you the finger -- And you can cram that file up your Secret Service sphincter.

question: You disappoint me, Mr. Anderson.
answer: You ain't seen nothing yet.

question: The irony of your situation is that you have no choice.
answer: You can't scare me with this gestapo crap. I know my rights. I want my phone call.

question: And tell me, Mr. Anderson, what good is a phone call iy you are unable to speak? You are going to help us, Mr. Anderson, whether you want to or not.
answer: The agents --

question: This has to be done for your protection and ours. You can't understand right now, but if you're not one of us, you're one of them.
answer: Va va va voom. Still the hottest software around.

question: Hello, Gizmo.
answer: This is really the guy? The guy that Morpheus thinks --

question: Yeah.
answer: But he's so old.

question: Are you going to help us or aren't you?
answer: Hacksaw. Load up the copper-top and let's get the hell outta here. Okay, first we take a little look under the hood. You're going to feel a little prick.

question: Hit him again! Got it!
answer: Neo, are you okay? It's over. We got it.

question: Nasty little bugger, ain't it?
answer: Thanks for your help, Gizmo.

question: I just hope the man knows what he's doing. Goddamn, what I wouldn't give for a copy of that software.
answer: Gizmo, you don't have the hardware to handle this software. Let's go. He's waiting. This is it. Let me give one piece of advice. Be honest. He knows more than you can possibly imagine.

question: At last. Welcome, Neo. As you no doubt have guessed, I am Morpheus.
answer: It's an honor.

question: Please. Come. Sit. Thank you, Trinity. I imagine, right now, you must be feeling a bit like Alice, tumbling down the rabbit hole?
answer: You could say that.

question: I can see it in your eyes. You have the look of a man who accepts what he sees because he is expecting to wake up. Ironically, this is not far from the truth. But I'm getting ahead of myself. Can you tell me, Neo, why are you here?
answer: You're Morpheus, you're a legend. Most hackers would die to meet you.

question: Yes. Thank you. But I think we both know there's more to it than that. Do you believe in fate, Neo?
answer: No.

question: Why not?
answer: Because I don't like the idea that I'm not in control of my life.

question: I know exactly what you mean. Let me tell you why you are here. You are here because you have the gift.
answer: What gift?

question: I've watched you, Neo. You do not use a computer like a tool. You use it like it was part of yourself. What you can do inside a computer is not normal. I know. I've seen it. What you do is magic.
answer: It's not magic.

question: But it is, Neo. It is. How else would you describe what has been happening to you? We are trained in this world to accept only what is rational and logical. Have you ever wondered why? As children, we do not separate the possible from the impossible which is why the younger a mind is the easier it is to free while a mind like yours can be very difficult.
answer: Free from what?

question: From the Matrix. Do you want to know what it is, Neo? It's that feeling you have had all your life. That feeling that something was wrong with the world. You don't know what it is but it's there, like a splinter in your mind, driving you mad, driving you to me. But what is it? The Matrix is everywhere, it's all around us, here even in this room. You can see it out your window, or on your television. You feel it when you go to work, or go to church or pay your taxes. It is the world that has been pulled over your eyes to blind you from the truth.
answer: What truth?

question: That you are a slave, Neo. That you, like everyone else, was born into bondage... ... kept inside a prison that you cannot smell, taste, or touch. A prison for your mind. Unfortunately, no one can be told what the Matrix is. You have to see it for yourself.
answer: How?

question: Neo, time is always against us. Will you take a seat there? I imagine you know sonething about virtual reality.
answer: A little.

question: Tell me about it.
answer: Essentially, it's a hardware system that uses an apparatus; headgear, gloves and whatever to make you feel that you are in a computer program.

question: If the virtual reality apparatus, as you called it, was wired to all of your senses and controlled them completely, would you be able to tell the difference between the virtual world and the real world?
answer: You might not, no.

question: No, you wouldn't.
answer: You did all this?

question: The pill you took is part of a trace program. It's going to make things feel a bit strange.
answer: Shit... What is this? Mescaline?

question: Just relax, Neo.
answer: Uh-oh...

question: I know.
answer: What are you doing?

question: Your muscles have atrophied. We're rebuilding them.
answer: Why do my eyes hurt?

question: You've never used them before. Rest, Neo. The answers are coming.
answer: Morpheus, what's happened to me? What is this place?

question: More important than what is when?
answer: When?

question: You believe the year is 1997 when in fact it is much closer to 2197. I can't say for certain what year it is because we honestly do not know.
answer: That's not possible.

question: I promised you the truth, Neo, and the truth is that the world you were living in was a lie.
answer: How?

question: This is the main deck. You know most of my crew. The ones you don't know. That's Mouse and Switch. The two big guys are Tank and Dozer. And this, this is the Core. This is where we broadcast our pirate signal and hack into the Matrix. Help him, Trinity. Do you remember when I asked you about an apparatus that could turn a virtual reality into reality? It's right here. And it's accessed here. This will feel a little weird. This is the Construct. It is our loading program. We can load anything from clothes, to weapons, to training simulations. Anything we need. Sit down.
answer: Right now, we're inside a computer program?

question: Wild, isn't it?
answer: This isn't real?

question: What is real? How do you define real? If you're talking about your senses, what you feel, taste, smell, or see, then all you're talking about are electrical signals interpreted by your brain. This is the Chicago you know. Chicago as it was at the end of the twentieth century. This Chicago exists only as part of a neural-interactive simulation that we call the Matrix. You have been living inside Baulliaurd's vision, inside the map, not the territory. This is Chicago as it exists today. 'The desert of the real.' We are, right now, miles below the earth's surface. The only place humans can survive outside the Matrix is underground.
answer: What happened?

question: It started early in the twenty- first century, with the birth of artificial intelligence, a singular consciousness that spawned an entire race of machines. At first all they wanted was to be treated as equals, entitled to the same human inalienable rights. Whatever they were given, it was not enough. We don't know who struck first. Us or them. But sometime at the end of the twenty-first century the battle was joined. The war raged for generations and turned the face of our planet from green and blue to black and red. It scorched and burned the sky. Without the sun, the machines sought out a new energy source to survive. They discovered a new form of fusion. All that was required to initiate the reaction was a small electric charge. Throughout human history we have been dependent on machines to survive. Fate, it seems, is not without a sense of irony. The human body generates more bio- electricity than a 120-volt battery and over 25,000 B.T.U.'s of body heat. We are, as an energy source, easily renewable and completely recyclable, the dead liquified and fed intravenously to the living. All they needed to control this new battery was something to occupy our mind. And so they built a prison out of our past, wired it to our brains and turned us into slaves.
answer: No! I don't believe it! It's not possible!

question: I didn't say that it would be easy, Neo. I just said that it would be the truth.
answer: Stop! Let me out! I want out!

question: I can't go back, can I?
answer: No. But if you could, would you really want to? I feel that I owe you an apology. There is a rule that we do not free a mind once it reaches a certain age. It is dangerous. They have trouble letting go.. Their mind turns against them. I've seen it happen. I broke the rule because I had to. When the Matrix was first built there was a man born inside that had the ability to change what he wanted, to remake the Matrix as he saw fit. It was this man that freed the first of us and taught us the secret of the war; control the Matrix and you control the future. When he died, the Oracle at the temple of Zion prophesied his return and envisioned an end to the war and freedom for our people. That is why there are those of us that have spent our entire lives searching the Matrix, looking for him. I did what I did, because I believe we have been brought here for a reason, Neo. You are here to serve a purpose, just as I am here to serve mine.

question: I told you I don't believe in fate.
answer: But I do, Neo. I do. Get some rest. You're going to need it.

question: For what?
answer: Your training.

question: Morning. Did you sleep?
answer: No.

question: You will tonight. I guarantee it. I'm Tank. I'll be your operator.
answer: You don't have...

question: Any holes? Nope. Me and my brother Dozer, we are 100 percent pure, old fashioned, home-grown human. Born free. Right here in the real world. Genuine child of Zion.
answer: Zion?

question: You are angry with me.
answer: I, uh... maybe.

question: It's all right. It's natural.
answer: I feel better.

question: Good, good. Anger is a gift, Neo, but it's a heavy one. Tank, load the jump program. You have to learn to let go of that anger. You must let go of everything. You must empty yourself to free your mind.
answer: Shit. Okie dokie. Yeah. Free my mind. Right. No problem.

question: Whoa! Shit, Neo, you scared the bejeezus out of ne.
answer: Sorry.

question: No, it's all right.
answer: What are you doing?

question: Midnight watch.
answer: Is that... ?

question: The Matrix? Yeah. You want a drink? I'll tell you, I feel for you, man. I really do. Most of us were still young, just punks, when Morpheus jacked us. But you, you had a real life. Good shit, huh? Dozer makes it. It's good for two things Did he tell you why he did it? Let me give you a piece of advice. Between you and me, if Morpheus says you can fly, I wouldn't go jumping out any windows to find out if he's right. Understand? Welcome to the real world! That's what he said to me nine years ago. The real world. Ha, what a joke. You know what real is? I'll tell you what real is. Real is just another four-letter word.
answer: Do we have a deal, Mr. Reagan?

question: Mmm, so, so fucking good. You know, I know that this steak doesn't exist. I know when I put it in my mouth, the Matrix is telling my brain that it is juicy and delicious. After nine years, do you know what I've realized? Ignorance is bliss.
answer: Then we have a deal?

question: I don't want to remember nothing. Nothing! You understand? And I want to be rich. Someone important. Like an actor. You can do that, right?
answer: Whatever you want, Mr. Reagan.

question: All right. You get my body back in a power plant, reinsert me into the Matrix and I'll get you what you want.
answer: Access codes to Zion.

question: I told you, I don't know them. But I can give you the man who does.
answer: Morpheus.

question: Jeez, I was wondering about that.
answer: What?

question: Why I was bald here but not in the Matrix. Residual self image.
answer: Good. Now what's this?

question: Life systems monitor, glucose levels.
answer: What's that?

question: Main power supply to the core.
answer: How about this?

question: Mainframe self-destruct. Uses all remaining power to generate an... E.M.P?
answer: Electromagnetic pulse. Our best weapon against the machines. The problem is if someone is still in the Matrix when that thing goes off, they're not coming back.

question: Did you have to do this?
answer: Yeah.

question: What did she tell you?
answer: Lots of things.

question: Any of them true?
answer: Some of them.

question: Do you now understand what it means when we say, if you're not one of us, you're one of them?
answer: The agents. They're sentient programs. They can commandeer any software hardwired to the mainframe.

question: Anyone that is still in a power plant. That is why we try to be invisible in the Matrix.
answer: The best hacking is always traceless.

question: There is no spoon. Right. Hello? Hello?
answer: I know. You're Neo. Be right with you.

question: You're the Oracle?
answer: Bingo. I got to say I love seeing you non-believers. It's really a relief. All that pomp and circumstances just plain tucker me out. Almost done. Smell good, don't they?

question: Yeah.
answer: I'd ask you to sit down, but you're not going to anyway. And don't worry about the vase.

question: What vase?
answer: The vase.

question: Shit, I'm sorry.
answer: I said don't worry about it. I'll get one of my kids to fix it.

question: How did you know...?
answer: What's really going to bake your noodle later on is, would you still have broken it if I hadn't said anything. You're cuter than I thought. I see why she likes you.

question: Who?
answer: Not too bright, though. You know why Morpheus brought you to see me?

question: I think so.
answer: So? What do you think? You think you're the one?

question: I don't know.
answer: You know what that means? It's Latin. Means, 'Know thyself.' Well, let's have a look at you. Open your mouth. Say, 'ahhh.' Hmmm. You sure got the gift, but it's tricky. I'd say the bad news is, you're not the one. Still got a lot to learn. Maybe next life.

question: What's the good news?
answer: Same as the bad news, you're not the one.

question: Is that it, then?
answer: No. Here. You better take a cookie. Got a big day ahead of you. Make a believer out of you yet.

question: What did you just say?
answer: Nothing. Just had a little deja vu.

question: What happened? What did you see?
answer: A black cat went past us and then I saw another that looked just like it.

question: How much like it? Was it the same cat?
answer: It might have been. I'm not sure. What is it?

question: Cypher has slipped and is wedged between the wall and several thick supply pipes. Neo pulls Cypher free just as the Cop OPENS FIRE --
answer: Are orders that hard to follow? I'll say it again. Morpheus must be taken alive. Understand?

question: They're almost falling, they're climbing so fast.
answer: How like a rodent.

question: So, we meet at last.
answer: And you are?

question: Smith. I am Agent Smith.
answer: You all look the same to me.

question: I've been waiting for this noment.
answer: Oh, so have I.

question: We need an exit!
answer: Gotcha. You're not far from Cypher.

question: Cypher, I thought --
answer: So did we. That boy's got nine lives. I sent him to Franklin and Erie.

question: In a way you're very lucky. Most people never know why they die. One minute they're alive, the next they're dead. No warning. Nothing. That's why I thought maybe I should tell you. It seemed the least I could do. You see, the truth, the real,truth is that the war is over. It's been over for a long time. And guess what? We lost! Did you hear that? We lost the war!
answer: What about Zion?

question: Zion? Zion is a part of this delusion. More of this madness. That's why this has to be done. It has to end. Now and forever.
answer: Oh rny God. This is abzut Zion. You gave them Morpheus for the access codes to Zion.

question: You see, Trinity, we humans have a place in the future. But it's not here. It's in the Matrix.
answer: The Matrix isn't real!

question: Oh, I disagree, Trinity. I disagree. I think the Matrix is more real than this world. I mean, all I do is pull a plug here. But there, you watch a man die. You tell me which is more real. Welcome to the real world, right?
answer: Somehow, some way, you're going to pay for this.

question: Pay for it? I'm not even going to remember it. It'll be like it never happened. The tree falling in the forest. It doesn't make a sound.
answer: Goddamn you, Cypher!

question: What are they doing to him?
answer: They're cracking his mind.

question: How?
answer: They inject virus-like serums to break down the system. It's like cracking a computer. All it takes is time.

question: How much time?
answer: Depends on the mind. But eventually, it will crack and his alpha pattern will change from this to this. When it does, Morpheus will tell them anything they want to know.

question: The access codes to Zion.
answer: If an agent got inside Zion's mainframe he could do anything. Disable the defense system. It would be the end of us. We can't let that happen. We have to do it, Trinity. Zion has to be protected.

question: If an agent got inside Zion's mainframe he could do anything. Disable the defense system. It would be the end of us. We can't let that happen. We have to do it, Trinity. Zion has to be protected.
answer: Goddamnit! Goddamnit!

question: We have to pull the plug.
answer: No!

question: We don't have any other choice. Trinity, what are you doing?
answer: I'm going in after him.

question: Morpheus could conform at any minute --
answer: If he does I'm sure you'll do what has to be done.

question: You saw that place. It's suicide. I know what Morpheus means to you --
answer: No. No, I don't think you do. If you did, then you would know that I'm not letting him go. Not without a fight, Tank. Not without a fight.

question: What do you think you're doing?
answer: You need help. I'm coming with you.

question: No. No way. Morpheus sacrificed himself so you could escape. There's no way you're going back in.
answer: Morpheus did what he did because he believed that I'm something that I'm not.

question: What?
answer: I'm not the One, Trinity. The Oracle told me. She said I had a gift but I still had a lot to learn. She told me maybe next life.

question: Did you tell Morpheus?
answer: Why? It wouldn't mean anything. He'd still believe what he wanted to believe. But Morpheus is the one that matters. He's more important than me and we both know it. I may not be what Morpheus thinks I am, but if I don't try to help him, then I'm not even what I think I am.

question: What are you?
answer: His friend.

question: Dodge this, motherfucker!
answer: Thanks.

question: You're hit --
answer: I'm fine. Can you fly that thing?

question: Don't! Get outta here. Okay? Run! Go!
answer: What happened? Was that --

question: It was nobody. Let's go! You first, Morpheus.
answer: Morpheus is right, you know. It doesn't matter what he believes or even what the Oracle believes. What matters is what you believe.

question: I believe... I want to kiss you.
answer: I want to kiss you too... But I want it to be real.
